description: Borrowed from Hebrew חֲגִיגָה‎ (ḥagiga, “celebration, pilgrimage, festival offering”), derived from the root ח־ג־ג‎ (ḥ-g-g, “celebrate, make a pilgrimage”). Cognate to Arabic حَجّ‎ (ḥajj, “pilgrimage”).

entries.meaning: A sacrificial offering at one of the three pilgrimage festivals: Passover, Shavuot (Pentecost), and Sukkot (Tabernacles).
The tractate from the Talmud that deals with these offerings.
